name: Jewish American Heritage Month
description: Annual recognition and celebration of American Jews' achievements and contributions to the United States of America.

name: Indigenous People's Heritage Month
description: Honoring and celebrating the culture, traditions, and customs of Indigenous Peoples.

name: International Holocaust Remembrance Day
description: Commemorating the victims of the Holocaust.

name: National Hispanic Heritage Month
description: Recognizing the contributions and influence of Hispanic culture to the nation's achievements, culture, and history.

name: Women's History Month
description: Highlighting the contributions of women to events in history and contemporary society.

name: Pride Month
description: Celebration of LGBTQ pride, commemorating the contributions of LGBTQ culture and community.

name: Black History Month
description: Remembering important people and events in the history of the African diaspora.

name: Asian American Heritage Month
description: Recognizing the contributions and influence of Asian Americans, Native Hawaiians and other Pacific Islander Americans to the nation's achievements, culture, and history.

name: International Transgender Day of Visibility
description: Celebrating transgender people and their contributions to society, and raising awareness of discrimination they face.

name: Juneteenth
description: Commemorating the ending of slavery in the United States.

name: National Coming Out Day
description: Celebration of the LGBTQI+ community's progress in fighting for equal rights.

name: Disability Pride Month
description: Celebrating people with disabilities, their identities, their culture, and their contributions to society.

name: Autism Acceptance Month
description: Recognizing the unique strengths and experiences of people with autism, and promoting their acceptance and inclusion.
